dt: {bc}to make ready beforehand for some purpose, use, or activity
{bc}to put in a proper state of mind
{bc}to work out the details of {bc}plan in advance

et: Middle English {it}preparen,{/it} borrowed from Middle French & Latin; Middle French {it}preparer,{/it} borrowed from Latin {it}praeparāre{/it} "to furnish beforehand, put in a state of readiness," from {it}prae-{/it} {et_link|pre-|pre-} + {it}parāre{/it} "to supply, provide, make ready" {ma}{mat|pare|}{/ma}
shortdef: to make ready beforehand for some purpose, use, or activity
to put in a proper state of mind
to work out the details of : plan in advance
